timings: Generally early morning until late evening with breaks for rituals (specific puja/timing windows vary by season) — Not documented precisely
entry_fee: No general entry fee; special darshan/queue passes may carry fees — Not documented
accessibility: City roads; large complex with many steps and crowds; partial wheelchair access in some areas but crowded — check locally for specific facilities
parking: Temple-managed parking + nearby paid lots; charges vary — Not documented
nearby_amenities: Plenty of restaurants, lodging (budget to premium), shops for religious items, public restrooms around the temple precincts
special_notes: One of southern India’s most famous goddess temples; centuries-old architecture and vibrant festival tradition; heavy crowds during festivals.

timings: Typically morning to evening (exact hours vary; often ~6:00–12:00 and 16:00–19:00) — Not documented precisely
entry_fee: Temple complex usually has no general entry fee; some guided/heritage services may charge — Not documented
accessibility: Well connected by road; temple has steps and heritage structures — wheelchair access limited in core sanctum areas
guided_tours: Local guides and archaeology/heritage tours available (Tamil/English)
parking: Nearby public/paid parking in Thanjavur city — charges vary — Not documented
nearby_amenities: Hotels, restaurants, handicraft shops, museums (Thanjavur Maratha Palace & Art Gallery nearby)
special_notes: Major Chola-era temple, part of UNESCO Great Living Chola Temples; architectural marvel with large vimana (tower).

timings: Individual monuments/park timings often ~ sunrise–sunset; specific museums may have set hours — Not documented precisely
entry_fee: Entry fees apply for certain monuments/archaeological sites (ASIs/heritage sites) — Not documented precisely
accessibility: Good road access via East Coast Road (ECR); monuments have steps and rocky terrain — variable wheelchair accessibility
guided_tours: Local guides (English/Tamil) and heritage walks available; many organized day-trips from Chennai
parking: Public parking in town; private parking at larger hotels and monument car parks — charges vary — Not documented
nearby_amenities: Restaurants, cafes, guesthouses, resorts, souvenir shops, restrooms
special_notes: Famous for shore temple, Pancha Rathas, rock-cut bas-reliefs (Descent of the Ganges), UNESCO heritage value (group of monuments), popular day-trip from Chennai.

category: Hill Station / Botanical gardens / Lakes / Nilgiri Mountain Railway
timings: Attractions (Botanical Garden, lake) have set opening hours — Not documented precisely
entry_fee: Botanical Garden / museums may have small entry fees — Not documented precisely
accessibility: Hill roads, winding but well maintained; many viewpoints require short walks/steps — partial wheelchair access in limited areas
guided_tours: Local guides and tour operators (English/Tamil) for tea estates, nature walks
parking: Hotel and public parking available; charges vary — Not documented
nearby_amenities: Hotels/resorts, cafés, restaurants, shops, trekking operators
special_notes: Famous colonial-era hill station, tea gardens, Nilgiri Mountain Railway (UNESCO tentative/heritage-noted), scenic viewpoints.

timings: Parks, lake boating hours governed locally — Not documented precisely
entry_fee: Boating and some park entries have fees — Not documented precisely
accessibility: Hill roads; many viewpoints require walking/steps; limited wheelchair access in core tourist spots
parking: Public and hotel parking — charges vary — Not documented
nearby_amenities: Restaurants, cafes, lodging, shops, medicinal plant stores
special_notes: Princess of Hill Stations; famous for Kodaikanal Lake, Coaker's Walk, Bryant Park, and nearby waterfalls.

timings: Temple opens early morning and closes late evening (ritual timings vary); exact daily schedule: Not documented
entry_fee: No general entry fee; certain rituals/scarlet services may have charges — Not documented
accessibility: Rameswaram is on Pamban Island accessible via road and rail (Pamban bridge); temple has long corridors and many steps — partial accessibility for mobility-impaired but long walking distances inside complex
guided_tours: Local guides available; pilgrim services common (Tamil/English)
parking: Town parking available; small fees locally — Not documented
nearby_amenities: Lodging, restaurants, shops for religious paraphernalia, pilgrim amenities
special_notes: One of the holiest Shiva temples; famed for ornate corridors and sacred tanks; part of Char Dham pilgrimage tradition for many.

timings: Ferry services run during daytime (subject to sea & weather conditions); monument visiting hours follow ferry schedule — Not documented precisely
entry_fee: Ferry charge to Vivekananda Rock & Thiruvalluvar varies (small passenger ferry fee) — Not documented precisely
accessibility: Access by ferry; walking on the rock memorial areas; recent infrastructure (including a glass bridge reported) — check local advisories
guided_tours: Local guides available in town; many package tours include Kanyakumari viewpoint at sunrise/sunset
parking: Public parking in Kanyakumari town; charges vary — Not documented
nearby_amenities: Hotels, seafood restaurants, souvenir shops, restrooms
special_notes: Southernmost tip of mainland India; spectacular sunrise & sunset views; cultural monuments and new pedestrian infrastructure (glass bridge) reported recently.

timings: Public beach; open 24 hours (individual attractions along the beach may have timings). Swimming discouraged/illegal in many areas due to currents.
entry_fee: Free (public beach)
nearest_bus: Many city bus stops along the beachfront; nearest major: Egmore/Chennai Mofussil bus stands
metro_station: No direct metro along entire stretch
accessibility: Road access good; wide promenades in parts with ramps (some wheelchair access) but sand & crowding limit mobility in many stretches
guided_tours: Not typical for the beach itself; city tours include Marina as a stop
parking: Several public parking lots and paid zones near the promenade — charges vary
nearby_amenities: Food stalls, cafes, lifeguard/police patrol; restrooms at some points, nearby hotels & tourist services
special_notes: One of the longest urban beaches; popular for walks, public events and memorials along the shore.

timings: Daytime visiting hours (sunrise–sunset); boating times subject to weather/water levels — Not documented precisely
entry_fee: Park/boat charges for coracle rides apply (local rates) — Not documented precisely
best_time: December–March & post-monsoon when flows are scenic; monsoon may be hazardous for boating
nearest_railway: Pennagaram/Dharmapuri area stations; Dharmapuri Railway Station
nearest_bus: Hogenakkal bus services from Dharmapuri/Bengaluru via bus; local bus stand at Hogenakkal village
nearest_airport: Bengaluru International Airport or Salem Airport
accessibility: Rocky uneven terrain; trekking/steps; not wheelchair-friendly in core waterfall areas
guided_tours: Local boatmen/guides for coracle rides (Tamil / some English)
parking: Local parking near entry; small fees generally — Not documented
nearby_amenities: Snack stalls, local eateries, basic lodging in nearby towns, restrooms
special_notes: Known as 'Niagara of India' locally; coracle rides and medicinal oil massage stalls nearby — check safety advisories during heavy flow.

category: Wildlife Sanctuary / National Park (part of Nilgiri Biosphere)
description: The Nilgiris / Erode / Tamil Nadu region
timings: Safari timings set by park authorities (morning & afternoon slots) — Not documented precisely
entry_fee: Park/safari fees apply (per vehicle / per person); permits required — Not documented precisely
nearest_railway: Mysuru / Mettupalayam / Ooty approaches depending on entry gate
nearest_bus: Local bus stands at nearby towns (Masinagudi, Theppakadu)
accessibility: Forest roads; 4x4 vehicle safaris; limited wheelchair accessibility in core forest areas
guided_tours: Park-run and private guided safaris (English/Tamil) available; advance booking often required
parking: Provided near park gates — Not documented precise charges
nearby_amenities: Forest rest houses, private resorts, basic eateries; visitor centres at main gates
special_notes: Part of Nilgiri Biosphere Reserve; good for elephants, tigers (rare), deer and birdlife — check park notifications for closures and permit procedures.

timings: Sanctuary hours typically daytime only (sunrise–sunset) — Not documented precisely
entry_fee: Small entry fee for visitors (state rates) — Not documented precisely
nearest_bus: Vedanthangal bus access from Chengalpattu / nearby towns
accessibility: Flat wetland trails and watchtowers; relatively accessible though boardwalks and steps exist — partial wheelchair access in some viewing areas?
guided_tours: Local bird guides / nature guides available (Tamil/English)
parking: Small parking at sanctuary entrance — Not documented
nearby_amenities: Small eateries in nearby villages, restrooms at entrance, limited lodging in larger towns nearby

timings: Open year-round
entry_fee: Free (individual attractions may charge small fees)
accessibility: Winding hill roads; generally well maintained
parking: Available at viewpoints, charges vary
nearby_amenities: Hotels, restaurants, cafes
special_notes: Known as the “Poor Man’s Ooty”; famous for Yercaud Lake, Pagoda Point, Lady’s Seat.

timings: Daytime, seasonal (June–September best for waterfalls)
entry_fee: Free (bathing areas may have charges)
accessibility: Road access good; slippery rocks near waterfalls
parking: Local parking, charges nominal
nearby_amenities: Lodging, food stalls, Ayurvedic centres
special_notes: Known as “Spa of South India” due to therapeutic waterfalls.

timings: Early morning to late night; rituals vary
entry_fee: Free; special darshan tickets available
best_time: Karthigai Deepam festival (Nov–Dec); generally Oct–Mar for weather
accessibility: City roads; temple has steps, large gopuram gateways
parking: Available nearby, charges nominal
nearby_amenities: Hotels, lodges, restaurants
special_notes: Famous for Arunachala hill; Girivalam (circumambulation) ritual draws lakhs of devotees.

category: Temple (Vaishnavite; largest functioning Hindu temple complex)
timings: 6 am – 9 pm (with breaks)
entry_fee: Free; ₹50–₹250 for special darshan
accessibility: Well connected; large temple complex, partially wheelchair accessible
parking: Nearby lots; charges apply
nearby_amenities: Restaurants, pilgrim lodges
special_notes: Rich temple architecture; important for Vaishnavites.

timings: Open year-round
entry_fee: Free; attractions may charge small fees
accessibility: 70 hairpin bends on ghat road; steep trekking at waterfalls
parking: Available near viewpoints
nearby_amenities: Resorts, homestays, food stalls
special_notes: Famous for Agaya Gangai waterfall, Siddhar caves, and hairpin bends.

timings: 8 am – 5 pm
entry_fee: Boating charges: ₹200–₹1000 depending on boat & duration
accessibility: Good roads; boats are rowboats/motorboats, not wheelchair-friendly
parking: Available at boating point
nearby_amenities: Restaurants, restrooms, shops
special_notes: Second largest mangrove in the world; popular for boating inside narrow creeks.

timings: 9 am – 6 pm (varies)
entry_fee: ₹10–₹50 (museum charges vary)
accessibility: Steps & courtyards; partial wheelchair access
parking: Available nearby
nearby_amenities: Restaurants, hotels
special_notes: Houses Saraswathi Mahal Library and art gallery with Chola bronzes.

category: Temples (Vaishnavite & Shaivite; one of Sapta Puri pilgrimage cities)
timings: Varies temple to temple (generally 6 am – 12 pm, 4 pm – 8 pm)
entry_fee: Free; special darshan fees at some temples
accessibility: Well-connected city; temples with steps, mixed accessibility
parking: Town parking spaces available
nearby_amenities: Silk shops, lodges, restaurants
special_notes: “City of Thousand Temples”; famous for silk sarees and heritage temples like Ekambareswarar, Kailasanathar.

timings: 9 am – 6 pm (closed Tuesdays)
entry_fee: ₹20 adults, ₹5 children, camera charges extra
accessibility: City location, good roads, walkways
parking: Paid parking near entry
nearby_amenities: Cafes, restrooms, museum
special_notes: Only national park inside a metro city; houses blackbuck, spotted deer, snakes, birds.
